title: A new low
body:
Just played a game with some of the *worst* toxicity I've ever had in all my years playing League.

Guy didn't call role, picked fizz ignite after Azir already called, went mid, yelled at Azir for absolutely nothing, let top lane get pushed in and crumble, yelled at our jungle for trying to defend top lane, mid lane goes on semi-tilt since he's feeding pretty hard, and baiting other players into fights.
All the while me and Jhin are actually winning botlane and almost pushing under their tier 2 tower.
Transition to teamfights, flames everyone for feeding, yells at us for picking on him, in turn get's called out in all chat, to which he starts playing the victim for the other team, claiming "he's being bullied" and "he called first" and "we're all big meanies and that we're just picking on him".

We've now got no way to know if the other team are actually going to report this person, since he's playing innocent, and our inherent desire to win is about naught.

Edgelord name, kindergarten bully tactics, and then playing "innocent" to the other team as soon as anyone retaliates?
Not to mention he tried adding everyone on our team multiple times after to continue his flaming.

How has someone with over 1000 games with this sort of attitude not been banned already?

replies.body:
If that's the player's name you've posted, you'll want to remove it or your post will be deleted. There's a no name & shame policy for the boards.

For the player's toxicity, mute in game, report after the game with as much detail as you can provide to help the process along. If it's really that bad, send a support ticket in with any information you can provide, including screenshots of his chat talk. And definitely don't let them add you post-game if they try.
Edgelord isn't the name you silly sausage.  He is saying the name is that of an Edgelord, like cervixbruiser or xXbigdick02Xx .

Silly sausage eh.

I'll be using that a lot now, it's catchy ! Good alliteration.

it is pretty old school - my mum and dad used to call me that instead of a ******* ****.

Other non-rude names include peanut, goose, and my LoL fav - potato.
Ah, I wasn't sure! I've never heard of an Edgelord as a thing before, so I just wanted to cover all the bases. :P
Well you learn something every day :P

Ignore them, report them.

Now if everybody follows this exact same rule these players will not be as common. The best you can do against a flamer is talk to the rest of your team and don't even respond to the toxic player. You can private message all the players with the /r*space**tab*'Name' to not respond to the person and just do your best teamwork with the rest of the nice players.
If everybody did this every game I guarantee toxic players would be a rare sight as they'd quickly realize how far being toxic gets them.

There was no point for you to write this whole thing.

I made sure to report, and indeed for most of the game, I was able to ignore, focussing more on getting Jhin fed and keeping bot lane above the rest of the enemy team-
But I kinda snapped at the last five minutes. At the point when he was called out and started playing innocent.
I can handle someone flaming, but that was an entire new level for me.

Indeed it was my fault for not muting once I knew something was fishy with his whole demeaner-
The loading screen tip was "players who follow the summoners code win 23% more games" and he literally started the game by repeating that and saying "good thing I'm not on your team" into /allchat.

I'll have to remember to start using the /r*space* thing for messages ingame, I hadn't thought of that before.

And yea, this whole post is entirely pointless past my need to vent after that experience, I'm happy to admit that, but it helped, and I'm about to queue up again.
With any luck I'll never see that Fizz again, whether or not he eventually get's banned for this kind of thing.
